abstracts.cdata!:
The Financial Sector Support (FSP)
            Project for Tanzania aims to increase the soundness and
            competitiveness of the financial sector and improve access
            by small savers and micro entrepreneurs to the formal
            financial system. The closing date for the project will be
            extended from July 31, 2011 until January 31, 2013. The
            extension of FSP is critical because the project provides a
            comprehensive coverage of the financial sector in Tanzania
            and supports most of the activities recommended by the
            Financial Sector Assessment Program (FSAP) update (September
            2010) under the government's financial sector
            framework. If no extension is made, a grace period of more
            than 18 months will be needed for some of the ongoing
            contracts whose expiry period extends up to 18 months
            according to the World Bank requirements. The extension of
            closing date is therefore critical to achieve the project
            development objective (PDO) and ensure its sustainability.
            This will be the first extension of the project.
